info.title: CRM Lists
info.description: CRUD operations to manage lists and list memberships

get.description: Fetch multiple lists in a single request by **ILS list ID**. The response will include the definitions of all lists that exist for the `listIds` provided.

parameters.name: includeFilters
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether or not the response object list definitions should include a filter branch definition. By default, object list definitions will not have their filter branch definitions included in the response.

parameters.name: listIds
parameters.description: The **ILS IDs** of the lists to fetch.

200.description: Successful response, for a request with `includeFilters` set to `true`.

post.description: Create a new list with the provided object list definition.

get.description: Retrieves a folder and recursively includes all folders via the childNodes attribute.  The child lists field will be empty in all child nodes. Only the folder retrieved will include the child lists in that folder.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The Id of the folder to retrieve.

post.description: Creates a folder with the given information.

put.summary: Moves a list to a given folder
put.description: Given a list and a folder, the list will be moved to that folder.

delete.description: Deletes the folder with the given Id.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to delete

put.description: This moves the folder from its current location to a new location. It updates the parent of this folder to the new Id given.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to move

parameters.name: newParentFolderId
parameters.description: The ID for the target parent folder.

put.description: Renames the given folderId with a new name.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to rename

parameters.name: newFolderName
parameters.description: The new name of the folder.

get.summary: Translate Legacy List Id to Modern List Id
get.description: This API allows translation of legacy list id to list id. This is a temporary API allowed for mapping old id's to new id's and will expire on May 30th, 2025.

parameters.name: legacyListId
parameters.description: The legacy list id from lists v1 API.

post.summary: Translate Legacy List Id to Modern List Id in Batch
post.description: This API allows translation of a batch of legacy list id's to list id's. This allows for a maximum of 10,000 id's. This is a temporary API allowed for mapping old id's to new id's and will expire on May 30th, 2025.

get.description: Fetch a single list by list name and object type.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: The name of the list to fetch. This is **not** case sensitive.

parameters.name: objectTypeId
parameters.description: The object type ID of the object types stored by the list to fetch. For example, `0-1` for a `CONTACT` list.

parameters.name: includeFilters
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether or not the response object list definition should include a filter branch definition. By default, object list definitions will not have their filter branch definitions included in the response.

200.description: Successful response, for a request with `includeFilters` set to `false`.

get.summary: Get lists record is member of
get.description: For given record provide lists this record is member of.

parameters.name: objectTypeId
parameters.description: Object type id of the record

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Id of the record

post.description: Search lists by list name or page through all lists by providing an empty `query` value.

requestBody.description: The IDs of the records to add and/or remove from the list.

get.description: Fetch a single list by **ILS list ID**.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list to fetch.

parameters.name: includeFilters
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether or not the response object list definition should include a filter branch definition. By default, object list definitions will not have their filter branch definitions included in the response.

200.description: Successful response, for a request with `includeFilters` set to `true`.

delete.description: Delete a list by **ILS list ID**. Lists deleted through this endpoint can be restored up to 90-days following the delete. After 90-days, the list is purged and can no longer be restored.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list to delete.

get.summary: Fetch List Memberships Ordered by ID
get.description:
Fetch the memberships of a list in order sorted by the `recordId` of the records in the list.

The `recordId`s are sorted in *ascending* order if an `after` offset or no offset is provided. If only a `before` offset is provided, then the records are sorted in *descending* order.

The `after` offset parameter will take precedence over the `before` offset in a case where both are provided.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
The paging offset token for the page that comes `after` the previously requested records.

If provided, then the records in the response will be the records following the offset, sorted in *ascending* order. Takes precedence over the `before` offset.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
The paging offset token for the page that comes `before` the previously requested records.

If provided, then the records in the response will be the records preceding the offset, sorted in *descending* order.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return in the response. The maximum `limit` is 250.

delete.summary: Delete All Records from a List
delete.description:
Remove **all** of the records from a list. ***Note:*** *The list is not deleted.*

This endpoint only works for lists that have a `processingType` of `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT`.

This endpoint only supports lists that have less than 100,000 memberships.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT` list.

put.description:
Add the records provided to the list. Records that do not exist or that are already members of the list are ignored.

This endpoint only works for lists that have a `processingType` of `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT`.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT` list.

requestBody.description: The IDs of the records to add to the list.

put.summary: Add and/or Remove Records from a List
put.description:
Add and/or remove records that have already been created in the system to and/or from a list.

This endpoint only works for lists that have a `processingType` of `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT`.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT` list.

requestBody.description: The IDs of the records to add and/or remove from the list.

put.summary: Add All Records from a Source List to a Destination List
put.description:
Add all of the records from a *source list* (specified by the `sourceListId`) to a *destination list* (specified by the `listId`). Records that are already members of the *destination list* will be ignored. The *destination* and *source list* IDs must be different. The *destination* and *source lists* must contain records of the same type (e.g. contacts, companies, etc.).

This endpoint only works for *destination lists* that have a `processingType` of `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT`. The *source list* can have any `processingType`.

This endpoint only supports a `sourceListId` for lists with less than 100,000 memberships.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT` *destination list*, which the *source list* records are added to.

parameters.name: sourceListId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the *source list* to grab the records from, which are then added to the *destination list*.

get.summary: Fetch List Memberships Ordered by Added to List Date
get.description:
Fetch the memberships of a list in order sorted by the time the records were added to the list.

The `recordId`s are sorted in *ascending* order if an `after` offset or no offset is provided. If only a `before` offset is provided, then the records are sorted in *descending* order.

The `after` offset parameter will take precedence over the `before` offset in a case where both are provided.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
The paging offset token for the page that comes `after` the previously requested records.

If provided, then the records in the response will be the records following the offset, sorted in *ascending* order. Takes precedence over the `before` offset.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
The paging offset token for the page that comes `before` the previously requested records.

If provided, then the records in the response will be the records preceding the offset, sorted in *descending* order.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return in the response. The maximum `limit` is 250.

put.description:
Remove the records provided from the list. Records that do not exist or that are not members of the list are ignored.

This endpoint only works for lists that have a `processingType` of `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT`.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the `MANUAL` or `SNAPSHOT` list.

requestBody.description: The IDs of the records to remove from the list.

put.description: Restore a previously deleted list by **ILS list ID**. Deleted lists are eligible to be restored up-to 90-days after the list has been deleted.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list to restore.

get.summary: Retrieve the conversion details for a list
get.description: Retrieve the conversion details for a list. This can be used to check for an upcoming conversion, or to get the details of when a list was already converted.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ID of the list to schedule the conversion for.

put.summary: Schedule or update the conversion of a list to static
put.description: Schedule the conversion of an active list into a static list, or update the already scheduled conversion. This can be scheduled for a specific date or based on activity.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ID of the list to schedule the conversion for.

delete.summary: Cancel the conversion of a list
delete.description: Delete an existing scheduled conversion for a list.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ID of the list that you want to cancel the conversion for.

put.description: Update the filter branch definition of a `DYNAMIC` list. Once updated, the list memberships will be re-evaluated and updated to match the new definition.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list to update.

parameters.name: enrollObjectsInWorkflows
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether or not the memberships added to the list as a result of the filter change should be enrolled in workflows that are relevant to this list.

put.description: Update the name of a list. The name must be globally unique relative to all other public lists in the portal.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The **ILS ID** of the list to update.

parameters.name: includeFilters
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether or not the response object list definition should include a filter branch definition. By default, object list definitions will not have their filter branch definitions included in the response.

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: The name to update the list to.

200.description: Successful response, for a request with `includeFilters` set to `false`.

filterBranchOperator.description: The logical operator used to combine filters within the branch.

filterBranchType.description: The type of the filter branch (PROPERTY_ASSOCIATION).

objectTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of object associated with the filter branch.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter branch (IN_LIST, NOT_IN_LIST).

propertyWithObjectId.description: The property that is associated with the object ID in the filter branch.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the number property operation (IS_EQUAL_TO, IS_NOT_EQUAL_TO, IS_GREATER_THAN, IS_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, IS_LESS_THAN, IS_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, HAS_EVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO, HAS_NEVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO).

value.description: The numeric value to be used in the operation.

day.description: The day component of the year reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the year reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the year reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the year reference.

month.description: The month component of the year reference.

second.description: The second component of the year reference.

id.description: The identifier for the filter metadata.

inListType.description: Specifies the type of list for the filter (WORKFLOWS_ENROLLMENT, WORKFLOWS_ACTIVE, WORKFLOWS_GOAL, WORKFLOWS_COMPLETED, IMPORT, DATASET, DATASETS).

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Specifies whether objects without a set value should be included in the operation.

lowerBound.description: The lower limit of the date range for the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the ranged date property operation (IS_BETWEEN, IS_NOT_BETWEEN).

requiresTimeZoneConversion.description: Indicates whether the operation requires conversion to a different time zone.

upperBound.description: The upper limit of the date range for the operation.

additionalProperties.description:
The property names of any additional list properties to include in the response. Properties that do not exist or that are empty for a particular list are not included in the response.

By default, all requests will fetch the following properties for each list: `hs_list_size`, `hs_last_record_added_at`, `hs_last_record_removed_at`, `hs_folder_name`, and `hs_list_reference_count`.

count.description: The number of lists to include in the response. Defaults to `20` if no value is provided. The max `count` is `500`.

listIds.description:
The `listIds` that will be used to filter results by `listId`. If values are provided, then the response will only include results that have a `listId` in this array.

If no value is provided, or if an empty list is provided, then the results will not be filtered by `listId`.

offset.description: Value used to paginate through lists. The `offset` provided in the response can be used in the next request to fetch the next page of results. Defaults to `0` if no offset is provided.

processingTypes.description:
The `processingTypes` that will be used to filter results by `processingType`. If values are provided, then the response will only include results that have a `processingType` in this array.

If no value is provided, or if an empty list is provided, then results will not be filtered by `processingType`.

Valid `processingTypes` are: `MANUAL`, `SNAPSHOT`, or `DYNAMIC`.

query.description: The `query` that will be used to search for lists by list name. If no `query` is provided, then the results will include all lists.

ListSearchRequest.description: The request object used for searching through lists.

hasMore.description: Whether or not there are more results to page through.

lists.description: The lists that matched the search criteria.

offset.description: Value to be passed in a future request to paginate through list search results.

total.description: The total number of lists that match the search criteria.

ListSearchResponse.description: The response object with the list search hits and additional information regarding pagination.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (IN_LIST).

listId.description: The ID of the list used in the association filter.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be performed by the filter (IN_LIST, NOT_IN_LIST).
Defines the operation to be applied within the filter (HAS_ANSWERED_SURVEY_QUESTION_WITH_VALUE).

surveyAnswerColId.description: The column ID of the survey answer used in the filter.

surveyAnswerRowId.description: The row ID of the survey answer used in the filter.

surveyId.description: The ID of the survey used in the filter.

surveyQuestion.description: The question from the survey used in the filter.

valueComparison.description: Specifies the operation used to compare the survey answer value.

comparison.description: Defines the comparison operation to be used in the refinement (BEFORE, AFTER).

ListsByIdResponse.description: The response object containing the lists found for a multi-list fetch.

businessUnitId.description: The ID of the business unit associated with the subscription filter.

channel.description: Specifies the communication channel associated with the subscription filter (EMAIL, WHATSAPP, SMS).

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter, which is (COMMUNICATION_SUBSCRIPTION)

subscriptionType.description: Defines the type of subscription related to the filter (PORTAL_WIDE, BUSINESS_UNIT_WIDE, INDIVIDUAL_SUBSCRIPTION)

additionalProperties.description: The name and value of any additional properties that exist for this list and that were included in the search request.

createdAt.description: The time when the list was created.

createdById.description: The ID of the user that created the list.

deletedAt.description: The time when the list was deleted.

filtersUpdatedAt.description: The time when the filters for this list were last updated.

objectTypeId.description: The object type of the list.

processingStatus.description: The processing status of the list.

processingType.description: The processing type of the list.

updatedAt.description: The time the list was last updated.

updatedById.description: The ID of the user that last updated the list.

rangeType.description: Specifies the type of range for the refinement criteria (BETWEEN, NOT_BETWEEN).

days.description: The number of days to offset.

hours.description: The number of hours to offset.

milliseconds.description: The number of milliseconds to offset.

minutes.description: The number of minutes to offset.

months.description: The number of months to offset.

quarters.description: The number of quarters to offset.

seconds.description: The number of seconds to offset.

weeks.description: The number of weeks to offset.

years.description: The number of years to offset.

filterBranchOperator.description: The operator used to combine filters within the branch (NOT_ALL).

filterBranchType.description: The type of the filter branch (NOT_ALL).

missingLegacyListIds.description: A list of legacy list ids that were passed in but not found. It will be empty if no id's are missing

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

formId.description: The ID of the form used in the filter.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be performed (FILLED_OUT, NOT_FILLED_OUT).

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

offset.description: The number of time units for the inactivity period.

timeUnit.description: The unit of time for the inactivity period, such as (DAY, MONTH, WEEK).

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

numberOfDays.description: The number of days to be considered in the rolling date range operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the rolling date range property operation (IS_LESS_THAN_X_DAYS_AGO, IS_MORE_THAN_X_DAYS_AGO, IS_LESS_THAN_X_DAYS_FROM_NOW, IS_MORE_THAN_X_DAYS_FROM_NOW).

requiresTimeZoneConversion.description: Specifies whether the operation requires conversion to a different time zone.

total.description: The total number of records that match the query.

associationCategory.description: Specifies the category of the association for the filter branch (HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, INTEGRATOR_DEFINED, WORK).

objectTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of object associated with the filter branch.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter branch (IN_LIST, NOT_IN_LIST).

day.description: The day component of the quarter reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the quarter reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the quarter reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the quarter reference.

month.description: The month component of the quarter reference.

second.description: The second component of the quarter reference.

subscriptionType.description: The type of subscription related to the filter (PORTAL, BRAND, SUBSCRIPTION, HARDBOUNCE, SPAMREPORT).

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the enumeration property operation (IS_ANY_OF, IS_NONE_OF, IS_EXACTLY, IS_NOT_EXACTLY, CONTAINS_ALL, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN_ALL, HAS_EVER_BEEN_ANY_OF, HAS_NEVER_BEEN_ANY_OF, HAS_EVER_BEEN_EXACTLY, HAS_NEVER_BEEN_EXACTLY, HAS_EVER_CONTAINED_ALL, HAS_NEVER_CONTAINED_ALL).

endpointBehavior.description: Describes the behavior at the endpoint of the time point operation.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be applied within the time point operation (IS_BEFORE, IS_AFTER).

propertyParser.description: Specifies the parser used for interpreting the property in the operation.

timePoint.description: Defines the specific point in time for the operation, which can be a date, indexed time, or property-referenced time.

type.description: Defines the type of operation being performed.

ListUpdateResponse.description: The updated definition of the list in response to a list update request.

filterBranchOperator.description: Specifies the logical operator used to combine filters within the branch (NOT_ANY).

filterBranchType.description: Indicates the type of filter branch (NOT_ANY).

indexReference.description: Specifies the reference point in time for the indexed time point.

timezoneSource.description: Specifies the source of the time zone information for the indexed time point (CUSTOM, USER, PORTAL).

zoneId.description: Indicates the identifier for the time zone associated with the indexed time point.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

lowerBoundEndpointBehavior.description: Describes the behavior at the lower bound endpoint of the time range.

lowerBoundTimePoint.description: Defines the lower bound time point for the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the time range (IS_BETWEEN, IS_NOT_BETWEEN).

propertyParser.description: Specifies the parser used for the property in the operation.

upperBoundEndpointBehavior.description: Describes the behavior at the upper bound endpoint of the time range.

upperBoundTimePoint.description: Defines the upper bound time point for the operation.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be performed by the filter (HAS_WEBINAR_REGISTRATION, NOT_HAS_WEBINAR_REGISTRATION, HAS_WEBINAR_ATTENDANCE, NOT_HAS_WEBINAR_ATTENDANCE).

webinarId.description: The ID of the webinar associated with the filter.

ListCreateResponse.description: The response for a list create request.

recordIdsMissing.description: The IDs of the records that were `missing` (e.g. did not exist in the portal) and so were not `added` or `removed`.

recordIdsRemoved.description: The IDs of the records that were `removed` from the list.

MembershipsUpdateResponse.description:
The IDs of the records that were `added`, `removed`, and/or found to be `missing` as a result of the 
membership update request.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

eventTypeId.description: The identifier for the type of event associated with the filter branch.

filterBranchOperator.description: The logical operator used to combine filters within the branch (AND).

filterBranchType.description: The type of the filter branch (UNIFIED_EVENTS).

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter branch (HAS_COMPLETED, HAS_NOT_COMPLETED).

maxOccurrences.description: The maximum number of occurrences allowed.

minOccurrences.description: The minimum number of occurrences required.

createdAt.description: The time when the list was created.

createdById.description: The ID of the user that created the list.

deletedAt.description: The time when the list was deleted.

filterBranch.description: Defines the filter criteria for the list, allowing for complex logical operations and nested filter branches to determine list membership.

filtersUpdatedAt.description: The time when the filters for this list were last updated.

objectTypeId.description: The object type of the list.

processingStatus.description: The processing status of the list.

processingType.description: The processing type of the list.

updatedAt.description: The time the list was last updated.

updatedById.description: The ID of the user that last updated the list.

firstAddedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the record was first added to the list.

isPublicList.description: Indicates whether the list is public.

lastAddedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the record was last added to the list.

listId.description: The unique identifier of the list.

listVersion.description: The version number of the list.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

ctaName.description: The name of the Call-to-Action (CTA) to be used in the filter.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied, which is (CTA).

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter (HAS_CLICKED_CTA, HAS_NOT_CLICKED_CTA, HAS_OPENED_CTA, HAS_NOT_OPENED_CTA, HAS_CLICKED_CTA_PLACEMENT, HAS_NOT_CLICKED_CTA_PLACEMENT, HAS_OPENED_CTA_PLACEMENT, HAS_NOT_OPENED_CTA_PLACEMENT).

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

ListFetchResponse.description: The response for a list fetch request.

filterType.description: Specifies the type of filter, which is (CONSTANT).

shouldAccept.description: Indicates whether the filter should accept the condition.

source.description: Defines the source of the constant filter.

setType.description: Indicates the specific set type used in the refinement (ALL, ALL_INCLUDE_EMPTY, ANY, NONE, NONE_EXCLUDE_EMPTY, ANY_INCLUDE_EMPTY).

childLists.description: An array of list Id's contained in this folder.

createdAt.description: The time the folder was created at.

parentFolderId.description: The Id of the folder this folder is in, the root folder is represented as 0.

updatedAt.description: The time the folder was last updated at.

updatedContentsAt.description: The time that the contents of the folder was last updated at.

userId.description: The user Id of the owner of the folder.

total.description: The total number of list memberships for the specified record.

comparisonPropertyName.description: The name of the property to compare against in the operation.

defaultComparisonValue.description: The default value used for comparison if the actual comparison property value is not set.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the comparative date property operation (IS_BEFORE, IS_AFTER).

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

lowerBound.description: The lower limit of the number range for the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the ranged number property operation (IS_BETWEEN, IS_NOT_BETWEEN).

upperBound.description: The upper limit of the number range for the operation.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

enableTracking.description: Indicates whether tracking is enabled for the page view.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (PAGE_VIEW).

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter (HAS_PAGEVIEW_EQ, HAS_PAGEVIEW_CONTAINS, HAS_PAGEVIEW_MATCHES_REGEX, NOT_HAS_PAGEVIEW_EQ, NOT_HAS_PAGEVIEW_CONTAINS).

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page to be used in the filter.

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

MembershipChangeRequest.description: The IDs of the records to add and/or remove from a list.

comparisonPropertyName.description: The name of the property to compare against in the operation.

defaultComparisonValue.description: The default value used for comparison if the actual comparison property value is not set.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied, such as comparison operators (IS_BEFORE, IS_AFTER).

before.description: The offset of the previous page of records.

link.description: A direct link to the request for the previous page of records.

PreviousPage.description: The cursor for the previous page of records.

eventTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of event for the integration event filter.

timestamp.description: Timestamp to be used in refine by criteria

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (SURVEY_MONKEY).

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be performed by the filter (HAS_RESPONDED_TO_SURVEY, HAS_NOT_RESPONDED_TO_SURVEY).

surveyId.description: The ID of the survey associated with the filter.

lowerTimestamp.description: Lower range timestamp of refinement criteria

rangeType.description: Type of range of refinement critaria (BETWEEN, NOT_BETWEEN)

upperTimestamp.description: Upper range timestamp of refinement criteria

day.description: The day of the month for the date operation.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included.

month.description: The month for the date operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the date property operation (IS_LESS_THAN_X_DAYS_AGO, IS_MORE_THAN_X_DAYS_AGO, IS_LESS_THAN_X_DAYS_FROM_NOW, IS_MORE_THAN_X_DAYS_FROM_NOW).

year.description: The year for the date operation.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the event filter by coalescing.

eventId.description: The ID of the event to be used in the filter.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (EVENT).

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the event filter (HAS_EVENT, NOT_HAS_EVENT).

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the event filter by pruning.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

eventTypeId.description: The identifier for the type of event in the unified events filter.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (UNIFIED_EVENTS).

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

day.description: The day component of the fiscal year reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the fiscal year reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the fiscal year reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the fiscal year reference.

month.description: The month component of the fiscal year reference.

second.description: The second component of the fiscal year reference.

fiscalYearStart.description: The month in which the fiscal year starts.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included.

operationType.description: The type of operation, which is (CALENDAR_DATE).

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied to the calendar date property (IN_THIS_TIME_UNIT, IN_THIS_TIME_UNIT_SO_FAR, IN_NEXT_TIME_UNIT, IN_LAST_TIME_UNIT).

timeUnit.description: The unit of time to be used in the operation (DAY, WEEK, MONTH, QUARTER, YEAR).

timeUnitCount.description: The count of time units to be applied in the operation (1).

useFiscalYear.description: Specifies whether the fiscal year should be used in the operation.

operation.description: Defines the operation to be performed on the property, such as comparison or value matching.

property.description: Specifies the name of the property that the filter is applied to.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

associationCategory.description: Defines the category of the association (HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, INTEGRATOR_DEFINED, WORK).

associationTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of association being filtered.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the association filter.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (NUM_ASSOCIATIONS).

associationCategory.description: Defines the category of the association, such as (HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, INTEGRATOR_DEFINED, WORK).

associationTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of association being filtered.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the association filter.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied, which is 'ASSOCIATION' by default.

listId.description: The ID of the list used in the association filter.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be performed by the filter, such as 'IN_LIST' or 'NOT_IN_LIST'.

toObjectType.description: The type of object that the association filter is targeting.

toObjectTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of object that the association filter is targeting.

appId.description: The ID of the application associated with the email event filter.

clickUrl.description: The URL that was clicked in the email event.

emailId.description: The ID of the email associated with the event filter.

level.description: Specifies the level of the email event, such as EMAIL_API_CAMPAIGN_GROUP.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter (BOUNCED, LINK_CLICKED, MARKED_SPAM, OPENED, OPENED_BUT_LINK_NOT_CLICKED, OPENED_BUT_NOT_REPLIED, RECEIVED, RECEIVED_BUT_NOT_OPENED, REPLIED, SENT, SENT_BUT_LINK_NOT_CLICKED, SENT_BUT_NOT_RECEIVED, UNSUBSCRIBED).

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

convertedAt.description: The date and time when the list was converted.

listId.description: The unique identifier of the list for which the conversion details are provided.

requestedConversionTime.description: The scheduled time for the list conversion, which can be based on a specific date or inactivity period.

filterBranchOperator.description: The logical operator used to combine the filters within the branch (OR).

filterBranchType.description: The type of the filter branch (OR).

coalescingRefineBy.description: Defines the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

formId.description: The ID of the form associated with the submission filter.

operator.description: Specifies the operation to be applied (FILLED_OUT, NOT_FILLED_OUT).

pageId.description: The ID of the page where the form submission occurred.

pruningRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by pruning.

includeUnassigned.description: Indicates whether unassigned memberships should be included.

membershipTeamId.description: The ID of the team associated with the membership.

coalescingRefineBy.description: Specifies the criteria for refining the filter by coalescing.

filterType.description: Indicates the type of filter being applied (PROPERTY_ASSOCIATION).

listId.description: The ID of the list used in the property association filter.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied by the filter (IN_LIST, NOT_IN_LIST).

propertyWithObjectId.description: The property associated with the object ID in the filter.

toObjectTypeId.description: The ID representing the type of object that the property association filter is targeting.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the string property operation ()IS_EQUAL_TO, IS_NOT_EQUAL_TO, CONTAINS, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH, HAS_EVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO, HAS_NEVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO, HAS_EVER_CONTAINED, HAS_NEVER_CONTAINED).

value.description: The string value to be used in the operation.

property.description: Specifies the name of the property that the time reference is applied to.

referenceType.description: Specifies the type of reference for the property (VALUE, UPDATED_AT, ANNIVERSARY, VALUE_WITH_ZONE_SAME_LOCAL_CONVERSION, ANNIVERSARY_WITH_ZONE_SAME_LOCAL_CONVERSION).

timezoneSource.description: Specifies the source of the time zone information for the property (CUSTOM, USER, PORTAL).

zoneId.description: Indicates the identifier for the time zone associated with the property.

Paging.description: The cursor to be used for paging through records.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the filter (PRIVACY_CONSENT_GRANTED, PRIVACY_CONSENT_NOT_GRANTED).

privacyName.description: The name of the privacy setting used in the filter.

filterBranch.description: Updated filtering criteria for the list

ListFilterUpdateRequest.description: The definition of the list filter branch update request.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the multi-string property operation (IS_EQUAL_TO, IS_NOT_EQUAL_TO, CONTAINS, CONTAINS_EXACTLY, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN_EXACTLY, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH).

dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week (SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY).

hour.description: The hour component of the week reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the week reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the week reference.

second.description: The second component of the week reference.

entityType.description: Type of ad entity (KEYWORD, ADGROUP, AD, CAMPAIGN)

operator.description: Operator to be applied (CONTAINS, IS_EQUAL_TO, ENDS_WITH, STARTS_WITH, IS_KNOWN)

searchTermType.description: Search term to match an ad

hour.description: The hour component of the current day reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the current day reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the current day reference.

second.description: The second component of the current day reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the current time reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the current time reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the current time reference.

second.description: The second component of the current time reference.

name.description: The name of the folder to be created.

parentFolderId.description: The folder this should be created in, if not specified will be created in the root folder 0.

day.description: The day component of the conversion date.

month.description: The month component of the conversion date.

year.description: The year component of the conversion date.

membershipTimestamp.description: The date and time when the record was added to the list.

recordId.description: The unique identifier of the record.

filterBranchOperator.description: The logical operator used to combine filters within the restricted filter branch.

filterBranchType.description: Specifies the type of the filter branch (RESTRICTED).

day.description: The day component of the month reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the month reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the month reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the month reference.

second.description: The second component of the month reference.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Specifies whether objects without a set value should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied, such as comparison operators (IS_BEFORE, IS_AFTER).

requiresTimeZoneConversion.description: Indicates whether the timestamp requires conversion to a different time zone.

timestamp.description: The specific point in time used in the operation.

campaignId.description: The ID of the campaign that influences the filter.

listId.description: The Id of the list to move.

newFolderId.description: The Id of folder to move the list to, the root folder is Id 0.

day.description: The day component of the fiscal quarter reference.

hour.description: The hour component of the fiscal quarter reference.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the fiscal quarter reference.

minute.description: The minute component of the fiscal quarter reference.

month.description: The month component of the fiscal quarter reference.

second.description: The second component of the fiscal quarter reference.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

legacyListId.description: The legacy list id for the list

listId.description: The V3 list id for the list

customProperties.description: The list of custom properties to tie to the list. Custom property name is the key, the value is the value.

filterBranch.description: Filter branch object containing filtering criteria for the list

listFolderId.description: The ID of the folder that the list should be created in. If left blank, then the list will be created in the root of the list folder structure.

name.description: The name of the list, which must be globally unique across all public lists in the portal.

objectTypeId.description: The object type ID of the type of objects that the list will store.

processingType.description: The processing type of the list. One of: `SNAPSHOT`, `MANUAL`, or `DYNAMIC`.

ListCreateRequest.description: The request object used when creating a new object list.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied in the boolean property operation (IS_EQUAL_TO, IS_NOT_EQUAL_TO, HAS_EVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO, HAS_NEVER_BEEN_EQUAL_TO).

value.description: The boolean value to be used in the operation.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indication of whether objects with no value should be included

operator.description: Operator to be applied (IS_KNOWN, IS_UNKNOWN)

operation.description: Defines the operation to be performed on the property

property.description: Specifies the property on which the operation is to be applied.

day.description: The day component of the date.

hour.description: The hour component of the time.

millisecond.description: The millisecond component of the time.

minute.description: The minute component of the time.

month.description: The month component of the date.

second.description: The second component of the time.

timezoneSource.description: The source of the time zone information.

year.description: The year component of the date.

zoneId.description: The identifier for the time zone.

amount.description: The numerical value representing the quantity of the time offset.

offsetDirection.description: Indicates the direction of the time offset, such as forward or backward.

timeUnit.description: Specifies the unit of time for the offset, such as days, hours, or minutes.

after.description: The offset for the next page of records.

link.description: A direct link to the request for the next page of records.

NextPage.description: The cursor for the next page of records.

includeObjectsWithNoValueSet.description: Indicates whether objects with no value set for the property should be included in the operation.

numberOfDays.description: The number of days to be considered in the rolling property updated operation.

operator.description: Defines the operation to be applied within the rolling property updated operation (UPDATED_IN_LAST_X_DAYS, NOT_UPDATED_IN_LAST_X_DAYS).
